lead_paragraph: Defense Secretary Ashton B. Carter expressed confidence that he would gain military pledges, but experts say the administration continues to miscalculate what the Arab countries are willing to do.

byline.contributor: Michael S. Schmidt reported from Brussels, and Helene Cooper from Washington. Eric Schmitt contributed reporting from Washington.
byline.original: By MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT and HELENE COOPER

headline.print_headline: Defense Secretary, Seeking Bigger Arab Effort Against ISIS, Faces a Challenge
headline.main: Challenge for Defense Secretary: Get Arab Allies to Do More to Combat ISIS

snippet: Defense Secretary Ashton B. Carter expressed confidence that he would gain military pledges, but experts say the administration continues to miscalculate what the Arab countries are willing to do.
abstract: Defense Sec Ashton B Carter is traveling to Brussels to meet with Arab allies to get them to do more to help combat Islamic State; analysts say Carter will face extremely difficult task, in part because foreign governments assume United States will go forward with or without their help.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
